before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"eu5i1","text":"When preparing plasmid DNA for sequencing, I follow one piece of advice that Dr. Divya Mirrington (ONT) gave me about pooling: create a pooled sample with volumes that you're  confident about, then remove an aliquot from that for adding the  remaining reagents [paraphrased]. I don't do any additional cleanup for  purified plasmid DNA; they tend to sequence very well on flow cells  without that cleanup.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"826f6","text":"My key requirement for plasmid  sequencing is a concentration of \u003e20 ng/μl (ideally by qubit or  quantus). Concentrations over 100 ng/μl should be diluted down. If the  plasmids can be diluted down to all exactly the same concentration (but  at least 20 ng/μl), or they're all similar lengths, then that makes  creating an equimolar pool much easier.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"24a0o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"984uj","text":"When creating the pools, I  add at least 1 μl of the the sample that I need to add the least for  (might be more if the total volume is less than 11 μl), then add the  corresponding amount of other samples to create an equimolar pool. I  then take 11 μl from the pool to be used for rapid adapter addition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9l83l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6on5r","text":"If samples are equal concentration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9b5h","text":"Add  amounts according to the length of the plasmid divided by the length of  the shortest plasmid. For example, if there are two plasmids, one with  length 3kb and another with length 35 kb, then add 1 μl of the 3kb  plasmid, and 35/3 = 11.7 μl of the 35kb plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5tg56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23lsl","text":"If plasmids are roughly equal length (i.e. less than ~10% length difference between plasmids):​","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":94}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eugrv","text":"Add  amounts according to the concentration of the highest-concentration  sample divided by the concentration of the plasmid. For example, if  there are three plasmids, one with concentration 50 ng/μl, one with  concentration 35 ng/μl, and one with concentration 20 ng/μl, then add 1  μl of the 50 ng/μl plasmid, 50/35 = 1.4 μl of the 35 ng/μl plasmid, and  2.5 μl of the 20 ng/μl plasmid. The total volume of this pool will be  less than 11 μl (1 + 1.4 + 2.5 = 4.9 μl), so in this case I would triple  these volumes (3 μl; 4.2 μl; 7.5 μl) to create a pool of \u003e 11 μl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fjt6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7vllb","text":"If samples are different concentrations and different lengths:​","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6q1l8","text":"Make  the sample prep easier. Use multiple flow cells for different plasmid  length ranges. Dilute higher-concentration samples down to the  lowest-concentration samples. I don't recommend trying to do both  calculations at the same time to determine added volumes because there's  a much higher chance of getting added amounts wrong, leading to wasted  samples or wasted flow cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5u8re","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9rf0u","text":"If you have a sufficiently-accurate pipetting robot, a sample sheet, and someone who is comfortable with equations:​","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":115}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5v7uf","text":"Pre-calculate amount to add assuming 12 μl total pool volume:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"84onc","text":"ratio = length / max(length) * max(conc) / conc​","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":8,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":35,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":43,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8grim","text":"volume = ratio * 12 / sum(ratio)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":9,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":26,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"batle","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5a5v1","text":"[That's my guess at the right equations; please let me know if there's an error]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fhvce","text":"This protocol demonstrates how to assemble reads from plasmid DNA, and generate a circularised and non-repetitive consensus sequence","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f9jcf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7fu3m","text":"At the moment, this protocol uses Canu to de-novo assemble high-quality single-cut reads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a795b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eqpbd","text":"Input(s): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f19d0","text":"demultiplexed fastq files (see protocol Demultiplexing Nanopore reads with LAST). I've noticed that the default demultiplexing carried out by Guppy (at least up to v4.2.2, as used in the first version of this protocol) has issues with chimeric reads, which can affect assembly.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":39},{"key":1,"offset":235,"length":14}],"data":[]},{"key":"491ue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"510ik","text":"Output(s):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"avnru","text":"Consensus sequence per barcode as a fasta file","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3F280CD53E9511EB8B380A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.7vmhn46"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"93AED5903E9511EB93BC851E3887A448","url":"https://doi.org/10.12688/f1000research.11547.2"}}}}

groups.title: High molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a3om","text":"If reads have been demultiplexed by MinKNOW, then the following approach should work to create the right input format:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a5omh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6495r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"arlgd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bgrli","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"47n81","text":"mkdir demultiplexed;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3adaf","text":"# readlocation is the directory that contains barcode subdirectories","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b7n6n","text":"readLocation = \"../*/fastq_pass\"; # or \"../*/pass\" for Guppy","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fqbrf","text":"for x in $(ls ${readLocation}); do","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2gnuu","text":"  echo ${x};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f0vcs","text":"  cat ${readLocation}/${x}/*.fastq | gzip \u003e demultiplexed/reads_${x}.fq.gz;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1los9","text":"  echo \"1 ${x}\" \u003e\u003e barcode_counts.txt;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6qfgn","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdfpj","text":"Filter out any reads that are less than half of the target read length, and determine the average quality of the remainder, keeping information on (at most) 100 of the highest-quality reads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3qfmt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b625t","text":"Check how successful the sequencer was at getting 100X coverage by counting lines:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5mkjv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bqre","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"64s3i","text":"Example output. In this case BC02 has fewer than 100 reads, so the assembly is less likely to be high-quality:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ekuht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bjv9i","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1n37a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6vjdm","text":"cat results/read_L50.txt | while read bc len;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bc3i7","text":"  do echo ${bc} ${len};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bgi7d","text":"  ~/scripts/fastx-compstats.pl demultiplexed/reads_${bc}.fq.gz | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"79efi","text":"    sort -t ',' -k 16rn,16 | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4di0r","text":"    awk -F ',' -v \"len=${len}\" \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cpp0g","text":"      'BEGIN{if(match(len, \"k\") \u003e 0){sub(\"k\",\"\",len); len=len*1000}}","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b5bge","text":"       {if($18 \u003e (len / 2)){print}}' | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fige1","text":"    head -n 100 | grep -v '^name' \u003e results/bestLong_100X_${bc}.csv;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ep5k3","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8q21","text":"wc -l results/bestLong_100X_*.csv","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1fn7r","text":"  90 results/bestLong_100X_BC02.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7l255","text":" 100 results/bestLong_100X_BC03.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"654k2","text":" 100 results/bestLong_100X_BC04.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8nlsr","text":" 100 results/bestLong_100X_BC05.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"p2fh","text":" 100 results/bestLong_100X_BC07.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"er5vb","text":" 100 results/bestLong_100X_BC09.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4c1b0","text":"590 total","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"car7h","text":"Create a LAST index for the reference sequence:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf08n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f78nv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"61f1m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l4r6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dh6sa","text":"lastdb -uNEAR -R01 reference/${REFNAME}.fa reference/${REFNAME}.fa","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnu07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mpsf","text":"Prepare a substitution matrix for barcode mapping. I recommend doing this by training LAST, and incorporating quality scores into the trained matrix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em59l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r0f3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"82hv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64fnm","text":"Copy the last few lines from the output into a text file called `plasmid.mat`","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4d71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1q1p","text":"Here is a matrix that I have created from plasmid reads called using the guppy super-accuracy basecaller, v5.0.13:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mlfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"745u5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1gkir","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c3180","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cngd","text":"This matrix has a moderate penalty for opening gaps (i.e. insertions and deletions), and a lower penalty for inserting them. Insertions are slightly less likely than deletions. It has a higher penalty for A/G transition variants, and a similar penalty for C/T transition variants as other substitution penalties.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4a4tt","text":"last-train {"blocks":[{"key":"87imm","text":"Map reads to the reference and convert to BAM format using maf-convert and samtools:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4o0m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i36b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"34uh1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9pl7m","text":"cat results/read_L50.txt | while read bc len;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2arha","text":"  do echo ${bc} ${len};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f92da","text":"  lastal -j 7 -P 10 -p plasmid.mat reference/${REFNAME}.fa \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"32di6","text":"      results/bestLong_100X_${bc}.fastq | last-split -n -m 0.99 | last-postmask | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f3a4b","text":"    maf-convert sam | samtools view -h --reference reference/${REFNAME}.fa | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3715p","text":"    samtools sort \u003e results/${bc}_vs_${REFNAME}.bam","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9lhn1","text":"  samtools index results/${bc}_vs_${REFNAME}.bam","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cr8fm","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64k6r","text":"Split reads into forward and reverse-mapped sequences, and tally up base counts at each location:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0uhj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b39cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g0gn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aje8u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dtf6r","text":"cat results/read_L50.txt | while read bc len;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"asmns","text":"  do echo ${bc} ${len};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8v21t","text":"  samtools view -b -F 0x10 results/${bc}_vs_${REFNAME}.bam | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"30mct","text":"    samtools mpileup --reference reference/${REFNAME}.fa -B -Q 0 - | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1jrcg","text":"    ~/scripts/readstomper.pl -c \u003e results/fwd_stomped_${bc}_vs_${REFNAME}.csv","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e9svc","text":"  samtools view -b -f 0x10 results/${bc}_vs_${REFNAME}.bam | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"al1lr","text":"    samtools mpileup --reference reference/${REFNAME}.fa -B -Q 0 - {"blocks":[{"key":"fu169","text":"Run a Canu assembly on each read set, using default options:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9j8fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"emuih","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2uq08","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"94qcu","text":"cat results/read_L50.txt | while read bc len;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bi657","text":"  do canu -nanopore results/bestLong_100X_${bc}.fastq \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"20bds","text":"    -p ${bc} -d results/canu_${bc} genomeSize=${len};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0cp8","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9seo","text":"Trim the assembled contigs based on Canu's trim recommendations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ava80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2umcv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4ttqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5284c","text":"cat results/read_L50.txt | while read bc len;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"23ruo","text":"  do echo ${bc} ${len};","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"537ev","text":"  samtools faidx results/canu_${bc}/${bc}.contigs.fasta \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5sjh9","text":"    $(grep '^\u003e' results/canu_${bc}/${bc}.contigs.fasta | \\","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2e0do","text":"      perl -pe 's/^\u003e(.*?) .*trim=(.*)/$1:$2/') \u003e results/circTrimmed_${bc}.fasta;","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"il9j","text":"done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brge2","text":"This protocol assumes the reference sequence has a name 'refName', and can be found at 'reference/refName.fa'. Change 'refName' here in the likely event that the sequence / file has a different name, then export the variable REFNAME to make subsequent steps easier.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":225,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5at90","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"en9u8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21vvu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fehc7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"98iiu","text":"export REFNAME=\"refName\"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
